page.title: 12Education-Ringland &Taverham
page.content: The village school closed in the 1960s and the children of Ringland had to come to school in Taverham. The{Le Neve Trust,}founded in the 18th century, was mostly spent on the children of Ringland, the amount depending on his attendance record and behaviour. Now that the local school has been closed, the trust benefits are spent on school uniforms and outings for local children. There is a field in Ringland the rent from which goes to the Le Neve Trust. {Taverham High School}in Beech Ave occupies 11 acres of land which used to be a turkey farm on the edge of the village. It opened in 1979 with room for 500 pupils, but now with mobile classrooms and extensions, it holds 700 mainly from Taverham and Horsford. There are 42 full time teachers. About 230 pupils stay to school lunch (cont)
